class_notes:
Enrollment is tiered to prioritize first and second year students. Additional seats will be added with each level of pre-registration, with most seats reserved for rising sophomores and incoming freshmen.  Questions email hcarpe5@emory.edu.


This survey course will introduce you to anthropology's distinctive perspective on becoming and being human through the sub-fields of cultural anthropology, biological anthropology, archaeology, linguistics, and applied anthropology. Ultimately, you will learn to examine your social worlds and the human differences you encounter through an anthropological lens and to think anthropologically about human possibility and the future.
course_description: Survey of the study of the human species: its evolution, prehistory, language, and comparative social and cultural systems.
sections: Class Nbr: 2596, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: D. Coppeto, Status: Open
